name: APT Trends Report Q3 2023
description: APT activity and trends as observed in Q3 2023 detailing extensive global cyber operations and indicators.

techniques.comment: Russian APT, spear-phishing emails with malicious Office documents initiating multi-level infection
Tools like RATs e.g. Quasar RAT, njRAT and Agent Tesla uploaded after gaining access via phishing
Activities include searching for files on victim machines, meant for data exfiltration
Reported use of obfuscation in .NET binaries and tools to disguise malware
Acts such as accessing victim email accounts via stolen cookies from browsers illustrate initial discovery attempts within compromised systems.
Usage of legitimate names and functionalities (e.g., posing as OpenVPN binaries) to avoid detection
Execution of malicious Python scripts as a part of multi-staged infection chains
Watering-hole attacks delivering payloads like Promethium affecting various regional targets
Use of Windows API calls to execute and control malware components and payloads
Use of various C2 channels, including mainstream cloud services, for managing infiltrated systems
Includes self-replication through connected secure USB drives to compromise air-gapped systems
BlindEagle's activity includes searching and extracting financial data from targeted systems
